details.caption: Menu
details.lov_json: select menu + ' - ' + sub_menu as temp2 from [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus] m, [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus_subs] s where s.website_id = m.website_id and s.website_id = {website_id} and m.sys_menu_id = s.sys_menu_id and s.target_window in ('Article','Event','Headlines','Horoscope','PhotoGallery1') and m.active = 'Yes' and s.active = 'Yes' and sub_menu is not null union select null as temp2 order by temp2
details.remove1: select m.menu + ' - ' + s.sub_menu as menu from [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus] m, [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus_subs] s, [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_polls] i where s.website_id = m.website_id and s.website_id = i.website_id and s.website_id = {website_id} and m.sys_menu_id = s.sys_menu_id and s.sys_menu_sub_id = i.sys_menu_sub_id and i.sys_poll_id = ?sys_poll_id
details.help_tip: Select Menu if you wish to show poll only on this Menu or keep Menu blank to show this poll on all Menus.

details.remove2: select s.sys_menu_sub_id from [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus] m, [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus_subs] s where s.website_id = m.website_id and s.website_id = {website_id} and m.sys_menu_id = s.sys_menu_id and m.menu + ' - ' + s.sub_menu = ?menu

details.caption: Poll Type
details.help_tip: Choose SingleChoice-Radio if you want voters to choose one item through radio button. Choose MultipleChoice-CheckBox if you want voters to choose multiple items using check boxes.

details.caption: Poll Location
details.help_tip: You can display up to 5 polls on different locations. By default, Poll1 is displayed. If you need additional polls, add one and tell us where you like it to insert since this requires changes from our support staff.

details.caption: Question
details.help_tip: Enter the question for this poll. A poll can have 7 possible answers.

details.caption: Answer 1
details.help_tip: Enter answer number 1 here. This is a required field.

details.caption: Answer 2
details.help_tip: Enter answer number 2 here. This is a required field.

details.caption: Answer 3
details.help_tip: Enter answer number 3 here. This field is optional.

details.caption: Answer 4
details.help_tip: Enter answer number 4 here. This field is optional.

details.caption: Answer 5
details.help_tip: Enter answer number 5 here. This field is optional.

details.caption: Answer 6
details.help_tip: Enter answer number 6 here. This field is optional.

details.caption: Answer 7
details.help_tip: Enter answer number 7 here. This field is optional.

details.caption: Header
details.help_tip: Header will be displayed on the top of Poll Result page.

details.caption: Footer
details.help_tip: Footer will be displayed on the bottom of Poll Result page.

details.caption: Show Detailed Poll Report
details.help_tip: Selecting Yes will show detailed poll report. Selecting No will show poll report without numbers and totals. Selecting Message will not show poll report and but will show message from Alternate Message below.

details.caption: Poll Title
details.help_tip: Type in the heading of the poll. For Example: This Week's Poll, Vote Today, Your Vote Counts, etc.

details.caption: Poll Button
details.help_tip: Localize voting button value in your language.

details.caption: Report Heading Value
details.help_tip: Localize report heading value in your language.

details.caption: Report Voted Value
details.help_tip: Localize already voted value in your language.

details.caption: Report Votes Value
details.help_tip: Localize votes value in your language.

details.caption: Report Total Votes Value
details.help_tip: Localize total votes value in your language.

details.caption: Alternate Message
details.help_tip: If you do not wish to show results at all and show your own custom message like Check our print edition for the results, use this Alternate Message box.

details.caption: Close Poll
details.help_tip: If you wish to end the poll and show only results to the visitors, choose Yes.

details.caption: Active
details.help_tip: Select Yes or No from the drop-down list. Selecting Yes will make this poll available immediately for your visitors to see. If you are not ready to show this poll at this time, select No. You can always come back to this poll by clicking on edit.

details.caption: Delete Message
details.default_value:
Do you want to delete current record?

This operation cannot be undone.

Are you sure you want to delete?

details.caption: Table Name

details.lov_json: select column_name from [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_tables_columns] group by column_name order by column_name

details.lov_json: select column_name from [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_tables_columns] group by column_name order by column_name

details.caption: Script Dynamic File1
details.lov_json: select column_name from [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_tables_columns] group by column_name order by column_name

details.lov_json: SELECT NAME FROM [AppData2].[dbo].[SYS_LISTS_MASTER] UNION SELECT NULL FROM [AppData2].[dbo].[SYS_LISTS_MASTER] ORDER BY NAME

details.caption: Delete Catelog
details.lov_json: select name from [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_delete_masters] order by name

details.caption: Column Name
details.lov_json: select column_name from [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_tables_columns] group by column_name order by column_name

details.caption: Special Active Column
details.help_tip: See sys_styles_details for an example.

details.caption: Advanced User Level
details.help_tip: Hide this field if User Level = Novice in Setup: Users screen.

details.caption: Key Type
details.help_tip: When choosing Composite or Unique, be sure to set Required=Yes.

details.caption: Ignore Blank Lines
details.help_tip: This flag is used to ignore blank lines during pasting in to memo field. For example, in most cases  it is set to Yes and one case such as List of Values in Setup: Forms is set to Yes.

details.caption: Service Package Insert
details.help_tip: Used this flag when creating Service Packages in process_insert_service_package_records.

details.caption: Convert HTML Bracket
details.help_tip: Convert < to < and > to >.

details.caption: Convert ENTER to BR tag
details.help_tip: Set Active=No if ENTER key is not needed to convert to BR tag. Example: Ad/Script box in ads screen is set to No.

details.caption: Exclude HTML Tags
details.help_tip: Setting Yes will exclude select HTML tags such iframe, script, etc from field to avoid listing issue under list.asp script.

details.caption: HPE
details.help_tip: Allow Hope Page Editor to see this field.

details.caption: Menu
details.help_tip: Enter a high level Menu name here such as NEWS. Under this NEWS menu, you would be creating sub menus such as SPORTS, BUSINESS, etc. The Menu does not accept special characters. If you need to display special characters or non-English characters, use 'Menu (HTML)' box below.

details.caption: Order No.
details.help_tip: Enter an order number to the Menus such as 1, 2.4, 3 etc. The menus will be displayed on your home page according to the order number you have assigned.

details.caption: Font Family
details.lov_json: SELECT FONT_FAMILY FROM [AppData2].[dbo].[SYS_FONTS] WHERE ACTIVE = 'Yes' ORDER BY FONT_FAMILY
details.help_tip: Select a font family for this Menu.

details.caption: Font Size
details.help_tip: Enter the font size of the menu here.

details.caption: Text Style
details.help_tip: Select the text style of the menu. Select Normal or Italic. Please note that you may see no changes in some font sizes or font types.

details.caption: Font Weight
details.help_tip: Select the font weight of the menu. Please note that you may see no changes in some font sizes or font types.

details.caption: Background Color
details.help_tip: Select a menu color here. Each menu can have different colors. You can click on square color box to select color or type any HTML color code from your paint programs.

details.caption: Text Color
details.help_tip: Select a text color here.

details.caption: Picture
details.help_tip: A menu can be a plain text or a picture (GIF, JPG, animated GIF). If you would like to have a picture then click on Browse button and select a file from your computer and you should see filename entered in this box. For more information on images, refer to chapter 19 on About Images / Pictures.

details.caption: Menu (HTML)
details.help_tip: If you know HTML coding, you can enter html text here. System will display HTML text instead of plain menu text.

details.caption: Make Hyperlink
details.help_tip: To make this menu as a hyperlink, put complete html A tag in above Menu (HTML) box and make this to Yes.

details.caption: Menu Link
details.help_tip: Provide full url to link other page.

details.caption: Menu Position
details.help_tip: There are four types of menu styles. Default will display menus classic style listed from top to bottom. Horizontal will display horizontally and mouse over effect will show sub-menus under it. Vertical will display Vertical and mouse over effect will show sub-menus under it. Sandwich will display all menus and sub-menus within popup.

details.caption: Attention Icon
details.help_tip: Select an attention icon. In selecting an attention icon, a small icon will be placed next to this menu on your homepage. For example, new, updated, sale, hot, etc.

details.caption: Sub-menu Columns
details.help_tip: If you have long list of sub-menus for this menu, it is possible that all sub-menus may not fit vertically or horizontally.  As a result, sub-menus may go outside of the screen where you will not be able see and click. By default, system displays sub-menus under 1column. You can increase the number of columns to 2, 3, 4, etc. where sub-menus will divided into such number of columns.

details.caption: Active
details.help_tip: Selecting Yes will make this menu available online immediately. Selecting No will not display this menu on your website, however, this menu will remain in your Site Manager for you to activate it at a later date.

details.caption: Sub Menu
details.help_tip: Enter a Sub Menu name here. For example: Sports, Business, Classifieds, Events, etc. The Sub Menu does not accept special characters. If you need to display special characters or non-English characters, use 'Sub Menu (HTML)' box below.

details.caption: Order No.
details.help_tip: You can assign order number to this Sub Menu such as 1, 2, 3 etc.  It can also be fractions such as 1.5, 2.6, etc.  This Sub Menu will be sorted on your home page according to the order number you have assigned here.

details.caption: Page Type
details.help_tip: 'Page Type' is directly related to Site Manager functions. For example, choosing 'Page Type = Article' allows you to update Articles from Site Manager.

details.caption: Articles Per Page
details.help_tip: If you wish to display more than one article on this sub-menu, choose a number between 0 and 25.  NOTE: Having higher number will make your page lengthier. We do not recommend higher than 5. Make sure to resubmit one article from this sub-menu under 'Article' screen to take effect.

details.caption: Archives Per Page
details.help_tip: You can display between 0 and 75 archives on this sub-menu. If you wish to display more than one article on this sub-menu, choose a number between 0 and 25.  NOTE: Make sure to resubmit one article from this sub-menu under 'Article' screen to take effect.

details.caption: Background Color
details.help_tip: Select a sub menu color here. Each sub menu can have different color. Click on square color box to select color or type any HTML color code from your paint programs.

details.caption: Background Color (MouseOver)
details.help_tip: A sub menu color changes in response to the mouse pointer moving over it. Select a sub menu (mouse over) color here. Each submenu menu can have different mouse over colors. Click on square color box to select color or type any HTML color code from your paint programs.

details.caption: Text Color
details.help_tip: Select a text color of this submenu here. Click on square color box to select color or type any HTML color code from your paint programs.

details.caption: Rule Color (between Menus)
details.help_tip: Select a rule color here. Click on square color box to select color or type any HTML color code from your paint programs.

details.caption: Sub Menu Bullet
details.help_tip: Put HTML code here that goes before the Sub Menu name. This is mostly used for placing bullets or small images such as 16x16, 24x24, 32x32, etc.

details.caption: Picture
details.help_tip: If you want sub menu to be an image, upload GIF, JPG, animated GIF image here. Click on Browse or Choose button and select a file from your computer and you should see filename entered in this box. For more information on images, refer to Chapter 19.

details.caption: Picture (MouseOver)
details.help_tip: If MouseOver image is uploaded, users will see this image whenever their mouse moves over this image. When the user moves the mouse off of the image, the original image will reappear.

details.caption: Icon File
details.help_tip: Instead of showing sub menu as a plain text, you can choose an icon from our system icon library. Click on 'select icon' link. Copy and paste filename here.

details.caption: Link URL
details.help_tip: If you wish to link this submenu to the external website, enter the full url of the website here.  The link has to start with http. For example, http://www.bulletlink.com. Make sure that Window Type is set to Link above.

details.caption: Link URL Window
details.help_tip: Select New if you want to open sub-menu link in a new browser tab, select Top if you want to open sub-menu link in a same browser tab.

details.caption: Sub Menu (HTML)
details.help_tip: If you know HTML coding, you can enter html text here. System will display HTML text instead of plain sub menu text.

details.caption: Header
details.help_tip: Headers will be displayed on top of your stories/pages.

details.caption: Footer
details.help_tip: Footers will be displayed on top of your stories/pages.

details.caption: Search Engine Friendly File
details.help_tip: By default system creates a file name like index1.htm, index5.htm, etc. for this sub-menu. Search engines like keywords in file name as well. Therefore, if your sub-menu name is 'Sports', you can type 'sports' in 'Search Engine Friendly File' field or you can further localize by adding local region such as 'nashville-sports', etc. This will improve search engine ranking for keywords when visitors search for 'nashville sports'.

details.caption: Website Title
details.help_tip: This Website Title is the first line displayed by the browsers on top. If left blank, system automatically uses global Website Title from Setup: Options (Layout) screen.

details.caption: Meta Keywords
details.help_tip: This Meta Keywords is used for search engines that can build index of your site using these keywords. If left blank, system automatically uses global Meta Keywords from Setup: Options (Layout) screen. Separate the keywords by commas. Start off by using the most effective keywords. For example, if you are selling computers, you could type computers, laptops, laser printer, toner. We recommend that you keep your Meta Keywords and the Website Title the same.

details.caption: Meta Description
details.help_tip: Write short description about this page. If left blank, system automatically uses global Meta Description from Setup: Options (Layout) screen.

details.caption: Restrict Access
details.help_tip:
You can make your site free or restrict access through paid options.
  • Select "No" if you want visitors to access your site for free.
  • Choose "Website" to restrict access to specific menus on your website.
  • Select "App" to restrict access to specific menus within your app.
  • Choose "Both" if you want to restrict access to menus on both the website and the app.

details.caption: Restrict Matching Ads
details.help_tip: Set this to 'Yes' if you want to show all ads assigned to this menu in 'Maintain: Customer Ads' screen. Set this to 'No' if you want to show all ads either assigned or not assigned to this menu in 'Maintain: Customer Ads' screen.

details.caption: Hide Sub Menu
details.help_tip: Set to Yes if you want to hide this sub-menu from home page.

details.caption: Approve Comments
details.help_tip: When visitors posts comments stories or guest book comments, you have the option to approve such feedback before showing on your home page.

details.caption: Photo Gallery Columns
details.help_tip: If you select 'Window Type = PhotoGallery' above, specify how many thumbnail columns you want to show on your home page.

details.caption: Photo Gallery Rows
details.help_tip: If you select 'Window Type = PhotoGallery above, specify how many thumbnail rows you want to show on your home page.

details.caption: Photo Size
details.help_tip: When larger images are uploaded in 'Maintain: News/Articles' or 'Maintain: Pages' or 'Maintain: Photo Gallery' screen, system automatically reduces the image width in pixel that you specify here. This will give your home page consistent look every time you upload images to each sub-menus.

details.caption: Photo Size (Thumbnail)
details.help_tip: If you select 'Window Type = PhotoGallery' above, specify thumbnail photo size in pixel here. System automatically creates thumbnail photos to the size you specify here. NOTE: Once photos are uploaded, changing size here again will not affect uploaded photos. System will use this size when you upload photos next time.

details.caption: Submit Button Value
details.help_tip: Submit Button value is required for submenus like GuestBook where you need button for visitors post comments.

details.caption: Attention Icon
details.help_tip: Select an attention icon. In selecting an attention icon, a small icon will be placed next to this sub menu on your home page. For example, new, updated, sale, hot, etc.

details.caption: Active
details.help_tip: Selecting Yes will make this sub menu available online immediately. Selecting No will not display this sub menu on your home page, however, this sub menu will remain in your Site Manager for you to activate it at a later date.

details.caption: Description
details.help_tip: Describe this responsibility.

details.caption: Major Category
details.lov_json: SELECT CODE_NAME FROM [AppData2].[dbo].[SYS_CODES] WHERE website_id = {website_id} AND active = 'Yes' AND CODE_TYPE = 'ClassifiedsMajor' union select null ORDER BY CODE_NAME
details.help_tip: Select a Major Category of your choice from the pull down list. If you have few classifieds, you may want to leave this blank. However, if you have long list of classifieds, you can further group classifieds with Major Category. To add Major Category, click on the help link from Site Manager and refer to Chapter 14 (How to setup categories / codes).

details.caption: Minor Category
details.lov_json: SELECT CODE_NAME FROM [AppData2].[dbo].[SYS_CODES] WHERE website_id = {website_id} AND CODE_TYPE = 'Classifieds' ORDER BY CODE_NAME
details.help_tip: Select a Minor Category of your choice from the pull down list. If you do not see the categories that you would like to have then create one now. Click on the help link from Site Manager and refer to Chapter 14 (How to setup categories / codes).

details.caption: Title
details.help_tip: Enter a title for this classified ad that will appear in bold on your home page.

details.caption: Starting Date
details.help_tip: Enter future date to start classifieds on future date OR leave blank to start today.

details.caption: Ending Date
details.help_tip: If you want to end this classified on a given date, enter a date here OR leave it blank to run  indefinitely.

details.caption: Body
details.help_tip: This is where you enter the main text for your event. This should be pure text. You can simply copy and paste text from your favorite word processor program such as Notepad, Word or PageMaker. To copy text from other word processor, keep this browser window open or minimize it, open your file through word processor, highlight the text to be copied, switch back to the browser window and paste your text.

details.caption: Picture
details.help_tip: This is where you attach a picture to a classified. Picture file should be in GIF or JPG format. For tips on images, see chapter Image/Picture Tips in documentation. To attach a picture, click on Browse button. Locate picture file in your machine and click Open. Filename along with the full path will be entered automatically. You can also directly type in filename and path here as well. You will not see actual picture here. You will simply see filename.

details.caption: Attention Icon
details.help_tip: Select an attention icon. In selecting an attention icon, a small icon will be placed next to this classified on your homepage. For example, new, updated, sale, hot, etc.

details.caption: Active
details.help_tip: Select Yes or No from the drop down list. Selecting Yes will make this event available immediately for your visitors to see. If you are not ready to show this event at this time, select No. You can always come back to this event by clicking on edit.

details.caption: Body
details.help_tip: This is where you enter the main text/body of this sign. This should be pure text. You can simply copy and paste text from your favorite word processor program such as Notepad, Word or PageMaker. To copy text from other word processor, keep this browser window open or minimize it, open your file through word processor, highlight the text to be copied, switch back to the browser window and paste your text.

details.caption: Date Range
details.help_tip: Enter a date range for this sign.

details.caption: Picture
details.help_tip: This is where you attach a picture to this sign. We have already entered sign pictures into the system. However, if you choose to have your own sign pictures, you may upload it by clicking on ‘Browse’ button. Picture file should be in GIF or JPG format. For more details on images see chapter ‘About Images / Pictures’ for details. To attach a picture, click on Browse button. Locate picture file in your machine and click Open. Filename along with the full path will be entered automatically. You can also directly type in filename and path here as well. You will not see actual picture here. You will simply see filename.

details.caption: Category
details.lov_json: SELECT CODE_NAME FROM [AppData2].[dbo].[SYS_CODES] WHERE website_id = {website_id} AND CODE_TYPE = 'Files' ORDER BY CODE_NAME
details.help_tip: You can organize your files by choosing proper categories. If you need to add/modify, categories, click on Codes from Site Manager.

details.caption: Name
details.help_tip: Give a unique short name so it can easily be referenced within your pages.  For examples: MyPhoto, MyPDF, MyVideo, etc. Do not put file extension such as .gif or .jpeg at the end. System will automatically append the file extension. Only alphabets, numbers and underscore characters are allowed.

details.caption: File
details.help_tip: This is where you upload a png, gif, jpeg, pdf, video or music file. Click on Browse or Choose button and locate picture/file on your machine. Filename will be entered automatically. To view/delete this picture/file, submit this form first then click on edit to come back this form and you will see view · delete links next to the Browse/Choose button.

details.caption: Heading
details.help_tip: Enter a heading for this event that will appear bold on your home page.

details.caption: Event Date
details.help_tip: Enter a date for this event.

details.caption: Ending Date
details.help_tip: Leave blank to keep this event on your home page forever. Put Ending Date to remove this event from your home page and set Active=No automatically after this date.

details.caption: Body
details.help_tip: This is where you enter the main text or description of this event. This should be pure text. You can simply copy and paste text from your favorite word processor program such as Notepad, Word or PageMaker. To copy text from other word processor, keep this browser window open or minimize it, open your file through word processor, highlight the text to be copied, switch back to the browser window and paste your text.

details.caption: Active
details.help_tip: Select Yes or No from the drop-down list. Selecting Yes will make this event available immediately for your visitors to see. If you are not ready to show this event at this time, select No. You can always come back to this event by clicking on edit.

details.caption: Issue Date
details.help_tip: Click to call calendar and select Issue Date. If you have a print edition, you may want to match this Issue Date with your actual print date so your articles are organized between online and print edition.

details.caption: Menu
details.lov_json: lov_json=LOVsystem(file=sys-menus-lov.json, fields={menu,sub_menu}, where={target_window:['Article']}, order:Ascending)
details.help_tip: Select menu to assign this article on your home page. This list is the combination of Menus and Sub-menus. You can set them up under 'Menus' from Site Manager. Be sure to choose 'Page Type = Article' under Sub-menu screen. For details on menu setup, click on 'Tutorials' from Site Manager and click on '4. Menus & Sub-menus'.

details.caption: Heading
details.help_tip: Type the heading for this article.

details.caption: Display Heading
details.help_tip: Select Yes or No whether you want to display this heading on your home page.

details.caption: Body
details.help_tip: Copy/paste your article here. Type {{more}} anywhere in the article to create Read More link. You can also click on PageDesigner link that allows you to format articles such as Bold or Italics, etc. While you are in PageDesigner, you can also copy/paste formatted article from other application such as MS Word.

details.caption: Body Alignment
details.help_tip: Select Body Alignment such as Left, Right, Center or Justify.

details.caption: Picture (primary)
details.help_tip: Optionally, you can upload and attach image to this article. Image should be either in PNG, JPEG, or GIF. For tips on images, click on 'Tutorials' from Site Manager and click on '22. Images / pictures'.

details.caption: Picture Caption (primary)
details.help_tip: Optionally, type a picture caption that goes along with this picture.

details.caption: Picture (secondary)
details.help_tip: Optionally, you can upload secondary picture to this article. This secondary picture is displayed while viewing full article. For tips on images, click on 'Tutorials' from Site Manager and click on '22. Images / pictures'.

details.caption: Picture Caption (secondary)
details.help_tip: Optionally, type a secondary picture caption that goes along with this picture.

details.caption: Picture Alignment
details.help_tip: Select Picture Alignment such as Left, Center or Right.

details.caption: Source
details.lov_json: lov_json=LOVsystem(file=sys-codes.json, fields={code_name}, where={code_type:['Source Lines']}, order:Ascending)
details.help_tip: Select Source from the list. You can customize the Source list under 'Codes' from Site Manager. For details on this setup, click on 'Tutorials' from Site Manager and click on '18. Categories / Codes'.

details.caption: By
details.lov_json: lov_json=LOVsystem(file=sys-codes.json, fields={code_name}, where={code_type:['By Lines']}, order:Ascending)
details.help_tip: Select By (staff name) from the list. You can customize the By list under 'Codes' from Site Manager. For details on this setup, click on 'Tutorials' from Site Manager and click on '18. Categories / Codes'.

details.caption: Allow Comments
details.help_tip:
This feature allows visitors to post their comments, opinions or blog on select articles. Selecting 'Yes' will display comments button under this article that will allow visitor to post comments or opinions on this article. To review and approve comments, click on 'Comments' from Site Manager.

You can also use third-party comments tool as well. In that case, select 'Yes (third-party)'. For details on third-party comments setup, click on 'Tutorials' from Site Manager and click on '31. Comment Tools'.

details.caption: Bookmark/Share Tools
details.help_tip: This allows you to add bookmark or sharing tools on your articles such as Facebook, Twitter, Blogger, Delicious, Digg, Google, MySpace, StumbleUpon, and many more. For details on this setup, click on 'Tutorials' from Site Manager and click on '30. Sharing Tools'.

details.caption: Drop Cap
details.help_tip: Choose Yes if you want first letter of this article to be bigger. To change style of this letter, click on 'Layout' from Site Manager. Click on 'styles', click on Pages' and click edit on 'Drop Cap'. NOTE: If you are using PageDesigner while uploading articles, set 'Drop Cap = No'.

details.caption: Website Title
details.help_tip: This Website Title is the first line displayed by the browsers on top. If left blank, system automatically uses Website Title from story Heading.

details.caption: Meta Keywords
details.help_tip: This Meta Keywords is used for search engines that can build index of your site using these keywords. If left blank, system automatically uses keywords from story Heading. Separate the keywords by commas. Start off by using the most effective keywords. For example, if you are selling computers, you could type computers, laptops, laser printer, toner.

details.caption: Meta Description
details.help_tip: Write short description about this page. If left blank, system automatically uses global Meta Description from 'Layout' screen.

details.caption: Starting Date
details.help_tip: By default system enters current date. If you enter future date, system will activate article on that date.

details.caption: Ending Date
details.help_tip: If you enter Ending Date, this article will no longer be available on your home page beyond Ending Date. If you wish to have articles searchable, archived and available on your home page all the time, leave Ending Date blank.

details.caption: Active
details.help_tip: Select Yes to show this article on your home page.

details.caption: Code Type
details.lov_json: lov_json=LOVsystem(file=sys-codes-master.json, fields={code_type}, order:Ascending)
details.help_tip: Choose Code Type here. This is common screen for building list such as classifieds categories, by lines for your article writers, directories, categories, etc.

details.caption: Code Name
details.help_tip: Type Code Name such as Auto for classifieds, Linda Johnson as By Line for article writers, etc.

details.caption: Menu
details.lov_json: select menu + ' - ' + sub_menu as temp2 from [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus] m, [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus_subs] s where s.website_id = m.website_id and s.website_id = {website_id} and m.sys_menu_id = s.sys_menu_id and s.menu_type = 'User' and target_window in('Link') order by menu, sub_menu
details.remove1: select m.menu + ' - ' + s.sub_menu as menu from [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus] m, [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus_subs] s, [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_links] i where s.website_id = m.website_id and s.website_id = i.website_id and s.website_id = {website_id} and m.sys_menu_id = s.sys_menu_id and s.sys_menu_sub_id = i.sys_menu_sub_id and i.sys_link_id = ?sys_link_id
details.help_tip: Select a menu of your choice from the pull down list.  If you do not see your menu that you would like to have then create one now from Setup: Menus & Sub Menus and make Window Type = Link.  Click on the ‘help’ link from Site Manager and refer to Chapter 2.0 (How to setup menus & sub-menus).

details.caption: Full Link
details.help_tip: Enter the full link of the website here.  The link has to start with http.  For example, http://www.bulletlink.com.

details.remove2: select s.sys_menu_sub_id from [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus] m, [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus_subs] s where s.website_id = m.website_id and s.website_id = {website_id} and m.sys_menu_id = s.sys_menu_id and m.menu + ' - ' + s.sub_menu = ?menu

details.caption: Restrict to Menu
details.lov_json: select menu + ' - ' + sub_menu as temp2 from [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus] m, [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus_subs] s where s.website_id = m.website_id and s.website_id = {website_id} and m.sys_menu_id = s.sys_menu_id and s.active = 'Yes' and m.active = 'Yes' and s.menu_type = 'User' and target_window in('Default') order by menu, sub_menu
details.remove1: select m.menu + ' - ' + s.sub_menu as menu2 from [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus] m, [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus_subs] s, [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_links] i where s.website_id = m.website_id and s.website_id = i.website_id and s.website_id = {website_id} and m.sys_menu_id = s.sys_menu_id and s.sys_menu_sub_id = i.sys_menu_sub_id2 and i.sys_link_id = ?sys_link_id
details.help_tip: If you wish to restrict this link to a particular sub-menu only, select a sub-menu from the drop-down list. For example, this is a sports related link and you want to display this link only when visitors click on your ‘Sports’ sub-menu.

details.remove2: select s.sys_menu_sub_id as sys_menu_sub_id2 from [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus] m, [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus_subs] s where s.website_id = m.website_id and s.website_id = {website_id} and m.sys_menu_id = s.sys_menu_id and m.menu + ' - ' + s.sub_menu = ?menu2

details.caption: New Window
details.help_tip: If you select Yes then this link will open up in a new window.  Users will have to exit this window in order to get back to your website.  However, if you select No then this link will open in the same window.  Users will only have to click on back to get to your website again.

details.caption: Active
details.help_tip: Selecting Yes will make this link available online immediately.  Selecting ‘No’ will not display this link on your website, and you can activate it at a later date.

details.caption: Leftside Background (color/image)
details.help: type color OR select image

details.caption: Rightside Background (color/image)
details.help: type color OR select image

details.caption: Top Background (color/image)
details.help: type color OR select image

details.caption: Outside Background (color/image)
details.help: type color OR select image

details.caption: Menu Font Face
details.lov_json: SELECT FONT_LIST FROM [AppData2].[dbo].[SYS_OPTIONS_SYSTEMS] WHERE website_id = {website_id}

details.caption: Body Font Face
details.lov_json: SELECT FONT_LIST FROM [AppData2].[dbo].[SYS_OPTIONS_SYSTEMS] WHERE website_id = {website_id}

details.caption: Heading Font Face
details.lov_json: SELECT FONT_LIST FROM [AppData2].[dbo].[SYS_OPTIONS_SYSTEMS] WHERE website_id = {website_id}

details.caption: User
details.help_tip: Type short User name for logging into Site Manager. User name is not case sensitive.

details.caption: Password
details.help_tip:
When new user logs on for the 1st time using this password, system will prompt user to change password of his choice. NOTE: Password is case sensitive. Make sure to include letters, numbers and following special characters in password.

! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + . , : [ ] { } < >

details.caption: Email
details.help_tip: If you forget password in the future, use this email for retrieving password via email.

details.caption: Override Default Values
details.help_tip: In some screens system recalls previously entered values such as Issue Date, default Yes/No values, etc. If you do not wish to recall such values, set 'Override Default Values = No'.

details.caption: Access Level
details.help_tip:
All Data: This option allows users to view, update and delete everyone's data.
User Data: This option allows users to view, update and delete only his/her data.

details.caption: User Level
details.help_tip: Our system is vast and advanced. Our system automatically starts you off as Novice user and hide advanced or not needed information in the beginning. Once you understand the basics, you can set this to Advanced.

details.caption: Ending Date
details.help_tip: If you wish to restrict user to access Site Manager until this date, type date here or leave blank which is good forever.

details.caption: Active
details.help_tip: If wish to disallow access to Site Manager, choose No.

details.checkbox_table_source: SELECT R.NAME FROM [AppData2].[dbo].[SYS_WEBSITES] W, [AppData2].[dbo].[SYS_RESPONSIBILITIES] R, [AppData2].[dbo].[SYS_USERS_RESPONSIBILITIES] U, [AppData2].[dbo].[SYS_USERS] U2 WHERE u.website_id = w.website_id and u2.website_id = w.website_id and u.website_id = u2.website_id and u.website_id = {website_id} AND R.NAME = U.NAME AND U.USER_ID = U2.USER_ID and U.USER_ID = 2 AND R.ACTIVE = 'Yes' AND U.ACTIVE = 'Yes' AND U2.ACTIVE = 'Yes' AND ((R.USER_LEVEL = U2.USER_LEVEL) OR U2.USER_LEVEL = 'Advanced') and (  (business_type = 'newspaper' and business_newspaper = 'Yes')or(business_type = 'general' and business_general = 'Yes')  ) ORDER BY R.NAME ASC
details.checkbox_table_target: select name, allow_update from [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_users_responsibilities] where website_id = {website_id} and user_id = {pkey} and name = {name}

details.caption: Company Logo
details.help_tip: Upload your company logo or masthead here from your computer. This logo can be GIF, JPEG, PNG or Flash file.

details.caption: Company Logo (mobile site)
details.help_tip: Upload your company logo or masthead small from your computer for mobile site. This logo can be GIF, JPEG or PNG file. We recommend 300 pix wide logo for mobile.

details.caption: Company Logo (Text)
details.help_tip: If you wish to have company logo as a text, type your company name here.

details.caption: Company Logo (HTML)
details.help_tip: If you wish to code HTML block for logo, put HTML code here. If you need to add images, upload them under 'Files' screen and refer to them in your HTML code.

details.caption: Compress Images
details.help_tip: For better performance, our system automatically compresses image files when you upload from your computers to our servers. We highly recommend that you keep this to Yes. Please note that our current system ignores animated gif file. If you are uploading animated gif file, set this to No and upload animated gif file again.

details.caption: Starting Page
details.lov_json: select menu + ' - ' + sub_menu as temp2 from [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus] m, [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus_subs] s where s.website_id = m.website_id and s.website_id = {website_id} and m.sys_menu_id = s.sys_menu_id and s.target_window in ('Classifieds','Article','Event','GuestBook','Headlines','Horoscope','PhotoGallery1','Product','Property','ServicePackage','Directory') and m.active = 'Yes' and s.active = 'Yes' and sub_menu is not null order by menu, sub_menu
details.remove1: select m.menu + ' - ' + s.sub_menu as menu from [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus] m, [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus_subs] s, [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_options_systems] i where s.website_id = m.website_id and s.website_id = i.website_id and s.website_id = {website_id} and m.sys_menu_id = s.sys_menu_id and s.sys_menu_sub_id = i.sys_menu_sub_id and i.sys_option_system_id = ?sys_option_system_id
details.help_tip: Select starting page as your home page.

details.remove2: select s.sys_menu_sub_id from [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus] m, [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus_subs] s where s.website_id = m.website_id and s.website_id = {website_id} and m.sys_menu_id = s.sys_menu_id and m.menu + ' - ' + s.sub_menu = ?menu

details.caption: Starting HTML File
details.help_tip: You can upload your own starting HTML file that may include under construction page or special page that may include ads, links, images or starting flash file. Here is how to upload Under Construction Page: Click on 'Files' from Site Manager. Upload HTML file. Refer that exact HTML file name here. For example: UnderConstruction. System automatically appends .htm. Uploading Other Starting Page: Click on 'Files' from Site Manager. Upload HTML file. Refer that exact HTML file name here but add prefix 1 to this file. Adding prefix 1 only loads this file one time. For example: If you upload file StartingFile, enter 1StartingFile. System automatically appends .htm.

details.caption: Contact Information
details.help_tip: Type Contact Information here. For example: bulletlink.com, 103 Hillcrest Drive, Murphy, TX 75094. Phone: 800-245-4046, sales@bulletlink.com. Leave this field blank if you do not want to show Contact Information on your home page.

details.caption: Company
details.help_tip: Type your company name.

details.caption: Email
details.help_tip: This email address is used as the 'From' sender when sending newsletters.

details.caption: Mobile
details.help_tip:
System automatically creates m.htm file that can be accessed via YourWebsite.com/m.htm where YourWebsite.com is your actual website. Set to Yes, if you want your mobile device users to automatically show m.htm of your website.
NOTE: If you want to show full view of your desktop site on your mobile devices, create a support ticket.

details.caption: Show Site Hits
details.help_tip: Select Yes if you want the site hits to be shown at the bottom of your home page otherwise select No.

details.caption: Hit Counter Caption
details.help_tip: Type in the caption that you would like for site hits.  For example, you are visitor number, total hits on this website, page viewed, etc.

details.caption: Display Highlight
details.help_tip: Select Yes if you wish to display Highlights on your home page.

details.caption: Highlight Caption
details.help_tip: Give a caption for the highlight here. For example, this weeks highlights, Top stories, Headlines, etc.

details.caption: Display Highlight Category
details.help_tip:
You have 2 options for displaying articles.

1. Make 'Display Highlight Category = Yes'. This displays sub-menus such as Business, sports, etc that are ordered in 'Setup: Menus & Submenu' screen. Within the sub-menus, system displays articles by latest updated articles.

2. Make 'Display Highlight Category = No'. This removes sub-menus names from highlight list and only displays articles by latest updated articles.

details.caption: Highlight Limit
details.help_tip: Enter a number here that represents how many articles you want to display in Highlight box when setting 'Add to Highlight = Yes' under 'Articles' screen. You can also leave blank so only latest 'Issue Dates' are shown. Make sure to update one article under 'Articles' screen to take effect this setting.

details.caption: Highlight2 Limit
details.help_tip: Enter a number here that represents how many articles you want to display in Highlight2 box when setting 'Add to Highlight2 = Yes' under 'Articles' screen.

details.caption: Highlight2 - Include Article
details.help_tip: When using Add to Highlight2 feature while uploading articles in Articles screen, set Yes / No whether to include body of the articles on your home page preview. When you set Yes, make sure you upload pure text for articles and NOT to use PageDesigner or upload HTML content that may cause unpredictable results on your home page.

details.caption: Highlight3 Limit
details.help_tip: Enter a number here that represents how many articles you want to display in Highlight3 box when setting 'Add to Highlight3 = Yes' under 'Articles' screen.

details.caption: Highlight3 - Include Article
details.help_tip: When using Add to Highlight3 feature while uploading articles in Maintain: News/Articles screen, set Yes / No whether to include body of the articles on your home page tab style preview. When you set Yes, make sure you upload pure text for articles and NOT to use PageDesigner or upload HTML content that may cause unpredictable results on your home page.

details.caption: Highlight4 Limit
details.help_tip: Enter a number here that represents how many articles you want to display in Highlight4 box when setting 'Add to Highlight4 = Yes' under 'Articles' screen.

details.caption: Highlight5 Limit
details.help_tip: Enter a number here that represents how many articles you want to display in Highlight5 box when setting 'Add to Highlight5 = Yes' under 'Articles' screen.

details.caption: Highlight5 Limit (display)
details.help_tip: Enter number between 1 and 10 to show number of articles in Highlight5 box.

details.caption: Highlight6 Limit
details.help_tip: Enter a number here that represents how many articles you want to display in Highlight6 box when setting 'Add to Highlight6 = Yes' under 'Articles' screen.

details.caption: Headline Page Limit
details.help_tip: Enter a number between 1 and 99 that controls how many number of articles to be displayed on Headlines page. You can also leave blank so only latest 'Issue Dates' articles are picked up and ordered as per menu orders. Make sure to edit or upload one article in 'Articles' to see the changes on your home page.

details.caption: RSS Feed Limit
details.help_tip: Enter a number between 0 and 99 that controls how many number of news/articles to be displayed in RSS feeds. Leave blank if you want to show news/articles with latest 'Issue Dates'. Enter 0 if want to turn off RSS feeds altogether. Make sure to edit or upload news/articles in 'Maintain: News/Articles' to see the changes on your home page.

details.caption: RSS Description Words
details.help_tip: Type a number between 0 and 99 to include number of words in RSS feeds from news/articles. Leave blank if you want to include entire news/article.

details.caption: RSS Image Inclusion
details.help_tip: Select Yes if you want to include Picture (primary) from articles in RSS feed.

details.caption: Enable Shopping Cart
details.help_tip: Select Yes if you would like people to order products through Shopping Cart system otherwise select No.

details.caption: Sales Tax
details.help_tip: Enter the sales tax that you would like to charge when a customer buys your product online through our shopping cart. For example, if you are collecting 8.25% sales tax on orders, type 8.25. If you are not collecting sales tax, enter 0.

details.caption: Sales Tax State
details.lov_json: SELECT CODE_NAME FROM [AppData2].[dbo].[SYS_CODES] WHERE website_id = {website_id} AND CODE_TYPE = 'States' ORDER BY CODE_NAME
details.help_tip: Leave Sales Tax State blank if you wish to tax on products for all States/Provinces or choose State/Province to apply tax on products to customers residing in State/Province only.

details.caption: Order Message
details.help_tip: You can enter a message after a customer had placed the order. For example, Thank you for your business, Thank you for choosing our service, etc that will be shown on last page of their order.

details.caption: Meta Keywords
details.help_tip: If you like your site to be included in search engines such as Google, type keywords that you think people would type in the search engine to search for your site. Separate the keywords by commas. Start off by using the most effective keywords. For example, if you are selling computers, you could type computers, laptops, laser printer, toner.

details.caption: Meta Description
details.help_tip: Describe your business here. For example, Biggest Computer Wholesellers.

details.caption: Website Title
details.help_tip: We recommend that you keep your Meta Keywords and the Website Title the same.

details.caption: Site Access
details.help_tip: Mostly, you want visitors to come to your site and explore all the contents. However, if you want visitors to pay for reading full articles or signup with your website and collect their information for future marketing, you can change to Restricted Access.

details.caption: Access Type (Unauthorized Message)
details.help_tip:
If this is restricted site, type a message that you want to read when visitors attempts to access pages without logins. For example, you can change the words that are in bold here but keep other html codes intact.
You have not logged in.
Please click here to login.

details.caption: Remove Blank Lines When Pasting
details.help_tip: Mostly, when adding news/articles/pages onto your website, you will be copying and pasting news/articles/pages from your program. During this copying and pasting process, you might have too many blank lines between paragraphs. You can remove those extra blank lines by making this field to Yes.

details.caption: Add Lines When Pasting
details.help_tip: Mostly, when adding news/articles/pages onto your website, you will be copying and pasting news/articles/pages from your program. During this copying and pasting process, you might require additional blank lines between paragraphs. You can choose any value between 0 and 9.

details.caption: Preserve Spacing
details.help_tip: HTML does not display multiple spaces, for example, between words. If you wish to display multiple spaces during paste or under PageDesigner, set Preserve Spacing = Yes.

details.caption: Enable Preview
details.help_tip: This will enable you to see news/articles/pages uploaded in advance by having Starting Date higher than the current date. To turn on the preview feature make select Yes otherwise select No. You must logon to Site Manager to see these articles on your home page. If you want to see how other users will see your home page, simply open up your site in a different browser window.

details.caption: Enable Website Search
details.help_tip: System puts a search box at the bottom of your home page. If you do not want to have search box then select No.

details.caption: Payment Form2
details.lov_json: SELECT NAME FROM [AppData2].[dbo].[SYS_CUSTOM_FORMS_MASTER] WHERE website_id = {website_id} AND ACTIVE = 'Yes' AND NAME NOT LIKE '{{%' UNION SELECT NULL AS NAME ORDER BY NAME

details.caption: Payment Form3

details.caption: Security Code Style
details.help_tip: This Security Code prevents automated junk form submissions and improves system performance. While the disguised textual code cannot be read by machine (computer program), it is easily read by a human. Click on view security code styles for available Security Code styles.

details.caption: Security Code Type
details.help_tip: Alpha generates alpha codes, AlphaNumeric generates both alpha and numeric codes and Numeric only generates numeric codes.

details.caption: Security Code Caption
details.help_tip: Non-English websites may want to translate these wordings into their own language.

details.caption: Security Code Help
details.help_tip: Non-English websites may want to translate these wordings into their own language.

details.caption: Display Current Date
details.help_tip: Choose date format of your choice to be displayed on your home page.

details.caption: Adjust Time
details.help: view current date/time
details.help_tip: Localize your website date and time against our servers by adding or subtracting minutes. For example, type 300 minutes to add 5 hours or type -300 minutes to subtract 5 hours. Our server time is US CST. Click on 'view current date' to see server and your local time.

details.caption: Show Article Date
details.help_tip: On the home page, you have the option to show news/articles by Issue Date, Posting Date, or None.

details.help_tip: Choose date format for showing articles on your home page. Choose TimeAgo to show hour and minutes.

details.caption: Article Timestamp
details.help_tip: This field allows you to put timestamp on articles instead of dates for certain number of days.  For example: 10 minutes ago, 10 days ago, etc. After this number of days has passed, you will see actual date instead of 10 minutes ago, 10 days ago, etc. depending "Article Date Format".

details.caption: Create Map Links With
details.help_tip: When you setup Yellow Pages, map links are automatically created. Choose your choice of site to create map links.

details.caption: Text Direction
details.help_tip: Make text direction Right-to-Left if your site uses languages such as Hebrew or Arabic.

details.caption: Google Analytics Account
details.help_tip: See Chapter 20 (How to view website statistics). For detailed website statistics tracking, copy and paste Google Analytics Account from google analytics site. Look for account that looks the UA-00000000-0 within google analytics site or script. Where 00000000-0 is your actual account number. This website statistics are free from Google. All you have you do is sign up using the following link http://www.google.com/analytics/sign_up.html. Allow about 24 hours for your website statistics reports to show up in Google Analytics.

details.caption: Home Page Width
details.help_tip: Choose your home page width between 500 to 5000 pixel wide. Although our system will now allow you to set page width up to 5000 pixel wide, we still recommand that you keep within 1000 range. You can follow the trends of other big sites like Yahoo.com or msn.com and set page width accordingly.

details.caption: Menu Width
details.help_tip: Choose menu width between 50 and 500 pixel wide.

details.caption: Right Ad Column Width
details.help_tip: Choose right ad menu width between 50 and 500 pixel wide.

details.caption: Maximum Article Image Width
details.help_tip: When larger images are uploaded in Maintain: News/Articles or Maintain: Pages screen, system automatically reduces the image width in pixel that you specify here. This will give your home page consistent look every time you upload story images.

details.caption: Show Emails in Posting
details.help_tip: When visitors posts feedback such as opinions on stories or guest book comments, you have the option to show their emails in the posts.

details.caption: Copyright
details.help_tip: This copyright notice is usually displayed on the bottom your home page. You can replace this line with your own wordings.

details.caption: Archive Style
details.help_tip:
Style1: This style shows archive listing that includes Headings.
Style2: This style shows archive listing that includes Issue Dates and Headings.
Style3: This style shows archive listing that includes Issue Date, Headings, By Lines, Source Lines, Images and first part of article text.

details.caption: Disable Right Click
details.help_tip: Setting Yes will disable mouse right-click that may prevent novice users from coping your images. However, when you visit website all browsers save images and files to temp folder on your machine where advanced user can view and copy them. Your other option is to watermark your images with your company name or site name.

details.caption: Send Support Ticket Emails
details.help_tip: When you create support tickets for help, our system sends email notifications whenever our support team updates your tickets. If you do not wish to receive email notifications, set this to No.

details.caption: HTML Encoding
details.help_tip: HTML encoding makes sure that text is displayed correctly in the browser and not interpreted by the browser as HTML. For example, if a text string contains a less than sign (<) or greater than sign (>), the browser would interpret these characters as the opening or closing bracket of an HTML tag. When the characters are HTML encoded, they are converted to the strings < and &gt, which causes the browser to display the less than sign and greater than sign correctly. This option applies within Site Manager forms only. Set to No if you are using other than English characters and when editing pages, content becomes garbled.

details.caption: Drag & Drop Files
details.help_tip: Select 'Yes' to use the drag-and-drop feature, or 'No' to upload files or images using the standard browser button.

details.caption: Site Manager Background Image
details.help_tip:
https://MySite.com/clients/MySite/MyImage.png This field shows random background scenic images, graphic images and pattern images including holiday images during holidays under Site Manager screens. Option 1. Type pattern if you wish to show random pattern background images including holiday background images during holidays. Option 2. Type scenic if you wish to show random scenic background images including holiday background images during holidays. Option 3. Type graphic if you wish to show random graphic background images including holiday background images during holidays. Option 4. If you wish to upload your own background image, upload image size 1920 pix wide by 1200 pix height under "Files" screen and put image URL here.
Example: https://MySite.com/clients/MySite/MyImage.png Option 5. Type none if you do not wish to show background images at all. NOTE: If you make any changes here, be sure to click on logout from Site Manager and log back in to see the effect.

details.caption: Sharing Tools Script
details.help_tip: Sharing Tools Script allow visitors to share your pages with many popular social sites such as Facebook, Twitter, etc. To use third-party sharing tools script, from Site Manager click on 'Tutorials' and click on '30. Sharing Tools'.

details.caption: Comments Script
details.help_tip: We have our own comments system that allows visitors to post their blog, comments or opinions on select stories. However, You can also put third-party comments script such as from DISQUS.COM here. Refer to Chapter 28.1 for details.

details.caption: Translate Script
details.help_tip: Translate tool allows visitors to translate your pages in different languages. By default, we included translate tool from Google but you can use such tool from other sites as well.

details.caption: Laterpay  Client ID  (For Contributions)
details.help_tip: In order to activate Contributions on your site, you'll need a Laterpay Client ID and Secret. Visit www.laterpay.net to sign up for an account. When you complete the sign-up process, you'll be assigned a Laterpay Client ID and Secret. Copy and paste your Laterpay Client ID into this field and hit the "Submit" button below to save it.

details.caption: Laterpay Client Secret  (For Contributions)
details.help_tip: In order to activate Contributions on your site, you'll need a Laterpay Client ID and Secret. Visit www.laterpay.net to sign up for an account. When you complete the sign-up process, you'll be assigned a Laterpay Client ID and Secret. Copy and paste your Laterpay Client Secret into this field and hit the "Submit" button below to save it.

details.caption: Appeal Header (For Contributions)
details.help_tip: Enter a brief call to action that gets your readers' attention.

details.caption: Appeal Description (For Contributions)
details.default_value: Ex. Your contribution helps us bring you topical news that matters.
details.help_tip: Use this space to explain why you're asking for support and how you intend to use those funds. Try to make an emotional connection.

details.caption: Suggested Contribution Amounts
details.help_tip: Enter up to four suggested contribution amounts using numeric values and dollar signs, separated by commas.

details.caption: Menu
details.lov_json: select menu + ' - ' + sub_menu as temp2 from [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus] m, [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus_subs] s where s.website_id = m.website_id and s.website_id = {website_id} and m.sys_menu_id = s.sys_menu_id and s.active = 'Yes' and s.target_window like 'Product%' order by menu, sub_menu
details.remove1: select m.menu + ' - ' + s.sub_menu as menu from [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus] m, [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus_subs] s, [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_products] i where s.website_id = m.website_id and s.website_id = i.website_id and s.website_id = {website_id} and m.sys_menu_id = s.sys_menu_id and s.sys_menu_sub_id = i.sys_menu_sub_id and i.sys_product_id = ?sys_product_id
details.help_tip: Choose Menu where you want this product to be displayed, example, clothing, computers, etc. Choose the Menu from the drop-down list. If you do not see the menu list, create a submenu with Window Type = Product or see Chapter 2.

details.remove2: select s.sys_menu_sub_id from [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus] m, [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus_subs] s where s.website_id = m.website_id and s.website_id = {website_id} and m.sys_menu_id = s.sys_menu_id and m.menu + ' - ' + s.sub_menu = ?menu

details.caption: Category
details.lov_json: SELECT CODE_NAME FROM [AppData2].[dbo].[SYS_CODES] WHERE website_id = {website_id} and CODE_TYPE = 'Products' ORDER BY CODE_NAME
details.help_tip: Select a category of your choice from the pull down list. If you do not see the categories that you would like to have then create one now. Click on the help link from Site Manager and refer to Chapter 14 (How to setup categories / codes).

details.caption: Product Name
details.help_tip: Describe product name in few words here.

details.caption: Product Code
details.help_tip: Describe product code. This may be short product name.

details.caption: Unit of Measure
details.help_tip: If you are selling product in quantities, choose Unit. If you are selling product by weight, choose Lb.

details.caption: Description
details.help_tip: This is where you enter lengthy description of this product.  This should be pure text or HTML text. You can simply copy and paste text from your favorite word processor program such as Notepad or Word. To copy text from other word processor, keep this browser window open or minimize it, open your file through word processor, highlight the text to be copied, switch back to the browser window and paste your text.

details.caption: Regular Price
details.help_tip: Enter the regular price of this product.

details.caption: Sale Price
details.help_tip: If there is a sale on this product then enter the sale price of this product here else leave it 0.

details.caption: Sales Tax
details.help_tip: Put sales tax on select product or leave blank to allow sales tax from 'Setup: Options (Systems)' screen.

details.caption: Service Fee
details.help_tip: This is special field. If you are selling such product that requires additional service fee, enter service amount here.

details.caption: Service Fee Description
details.help_tip: If you have put Service Fee above, type service fee description here.

details.caption: Sale Start Date
details.help_tip: If you enter a date here, then the product will start showing up on your home page on that particular date or leave it blank and system will show it now. For example, if you enter 1/31/05, then this product will be displayed on your home page from 1/31/05 only.

details.caption: Sale End Date
details.help_tip: If you enter a date here, then this product will end after that perticular date. For example, if you enter 1/31/05, then this will not be displayed after date 1/31/05.

details.caption: Picture
details.help_tip: This is where you attach a picture of this product. Picture file should be in GIF or JPG format. See chapter Image/Picture Tips for details. To attach a picture, click on Browse button. Locate picture file in your machine and click Open. Filename along with the full path will be entered automatically. You can also directly type in filename and path here as well. You will not see actual picture here. You will simply see filename.

details.caption: Picture (thumbnail)
details.help_tip: This is where you attach a thumbnail picture of this product. If you upload thumbnail picture, system will show that first. Picture file should be in GIF or JPG format. See chapter Image/Picture Tips for details. To attach a picture, click on Browse button. Locate picture file in your machine and click Open. Filename along with the full path will be entered automatically. You can also directly type in filename and path here as well. You will not see actual picture here. You will simply see filename.

details.caption: Weight (in lbs)
details.help_tip: Enter the weight of this product in pounds here. This is used for calculating shipping cost using weight. You can setup shipping methods and weight table in Setup: Shipping Methods screen.

details.caption: Order#
details.help_tip: Enter an order number of this product, such as 1, 2, 2.4, 3, etc. The products will be displayed on your home page according to the order number you have assigned.

details.caption: Attention Icon
details.help_tip: Select an attention icon. In selecting an attention icon, a small icon will be placed next to this product on your homepage. For example, new, updated, sale, hot, etc.

details.caption: Active
details.help_tip: Select Yes or No from the drop-down list. Selecting Yes will make this product available immediately for your visitors to see. If you are not ready to show this product at this time, select No. You can always come back to this product by clicking on edit.

details.caption: Menu

details.help_tip: Select a category of your choice from the pull down list. If you do not see the categories that you would like to have, create one under 'Settings' screen from Site Manager.

details.caption: Company
details.help_tip: Enter company name of this customer. This is a required field.

details.caption: Company Logo
details.help_tip: Upload company logo here from your computer. This logo can be GIF, JPEG, PNG..

details.caption: Phone
details.help_tip: Enter phone number of this customer. This is a required field.

details.caption: First Name
details.help_tip: Enter first name of this customer.

details.caption: Last Name
details.help_tip: Enter last name of this customer.

details.caption: Address
details.help_tip: Enter address of this customer.

details.caption: City
details.help_tip: Enter city of this customer.

details.caption: State/Province
details.lov_json: SELECT CODE_NAME FROM [AppData2].[dbo].[SYS_CODES] WHERE website_id = {website_id} AND CODE_TYPE = 'States' ORDER BY CODE_NAME
details.help_tip: Enter state/province of this customer. You can customize state listings according to your country in ‘Setup: Codes’ screen from Site Manager.

details.caption: Zip/Postal Code
details.help_tip: Enter zip code of this customer.

details.caption: Country
details.lov_json: SELECT CODE_NAME FROM [AppData2].[dbo].[SYS_CODES] WHERE website_id = {website_id} AND CODE_TYPE = 'Countries' ORDER BY CODE_NAME
details.help_tip: Enter country of this customer. You can customize country listings according to your needs in ‘Setup: Codes’ screen from Site Manager.

details.caption: Cell
details.help_tip: Enter cell phone number of this customer.

details.caption: Email
details.help_tip: Enter email address of this customer.

details.caption: Website
details.help_tip: If this customer has a website then enter his full website address here. (For example: http://www.cnn.com)

details.caption: Facebook
details.help_tip: Type Facebook page link here.

details.caption: Twitter
details.help_tip: Type Twitter page link here.

details.caption: Profile
details.help_tip: Here you can enter additional information of this customer.

details.caption: Picture
details.help_tip: Optionally, you can attach a picture of this customer or staff photo, etc. This is not a banner ad. You will enter banner ads in Maintain: Customer Advertisements screen. Picture file should be in GIF or JPG format. For tips on images, see chapter Image/Picture Tips in documentation. To attach a picture, click on Browse button. Locate picture file in your machine and click Open. Filename along with the full path will be entered automatically. You can also directly type in filename and path here as well. You will not see actual picture here. You will simply see filename.

details.caption: Coupons
details.help_tip: You can upload coupons file in gif, jpeg or pdf formats.

details.caption: Ending Date
details.help_tip: If you enter a date here, then this yellow page listing will stop displaying on your home page under the Yellow page section from that ending date onwards. For example, if you enter 1/31/05 here, then this customer will not be displayed on your home page from 1/31/05 onwards.

details.caption: Attention Icon
details.help_tip: Select an attention icon. In selecting an attention icon, a small icon will be placed next to this yellow page listing on your homepage. For example, new, updated, sale, hot, etc.

details.caption: Order No
details.help_tip: Enter an order number to the yellow page listings such as 1, 2, 3 etc. The yellow page listing will be displayed on your home page according to the order number you have assigned.

details.caption: Comments for Yourself
details.help_tip: This is confidential comments field for your reference only. This will not be displayed on your home page.

details.caption: Active
details.help_tip: You can activate or inactivate this customer by choosing Yes or No.

details.remove2: SELECT CUSTOMER_ID FROM [AppData2].[dbo].[AR_CUSTOMERS] WHERE website_id = {website_id} and COMPANY = ?COMPANY

details.caption: Company
details.lov_json: SELECT COMPANY FROM [AppData2].[dbo].[AR_CUSTOMERS] WHERE website_id = {website_id} and ACTIVE = 'Yes' union SELECT NULL ORDER BY COMPANY
details.remove1: SELECT C.COMPANY FROM [AppData2].[dbo].[AR_CUSTOMERS] C, [AppData2].[dbo].[AR_CUSTOMERS_ADS] A WHERE a.website_id = c.website_id and a.website_id = {website_id} and A.CUSTOMER_ID = C.CUSTOMER_ID AND A.AR_CUSTOMERS_ADS_ID = ?AR_CUSTOMERS_ADS_ID
details.help_tip: Select a Company (customer) from the drop-down list.

details.caption: Ad Description
details.help_tip: Enter description for this. Examples: Toyota, weather, etc. If you have many ads, come up with good naming convention such as Company + Description. Example: Toyota-Summer Sale, Toyota-Winter Sale, etc. This will help you quick search and updates. If you are using Google Analytics, system uses first 25 characters of this Ad Description so you can identify this ad in Google Analytics system.

details.caption: Ad Position
details.help_tip: You can have ads on the Top, Bottom, Left or Right.  Select Ad Position from the drop-down list. Position Top will display ads on the top of your home page. Position Right will display ads on the right side of your home page. Position Left will display ads on the left side of your home page. Position Bottom will display ads on the bottom of your home page. We recommend to limit total ads to less than 10 otherwise your website will be slow.

details.caption: Order No
details.help_tip: Give order number to this group of ads such as 1, 2, 2.7, 3 etc. to be displayed on the home page.

details.caption: Starting Date
details.help_tip: If you wish to start this ad at a later date, enter a future date or accept current date to start now.

details.caption: Ending Date
details.help_tip: If you wish to end this ad on a particular date, enter a date or leave it blank for continued run.

details.caption: Maximum Hits
details.help_tip: You can also choose to end this advertisement by entering a number. For example, if you have entered 1000, system will automatically stop displaying this advertisement on the home page after 1000 hits. If you have entered both Ending Date and Maximum Hits, this advertisement will end when either of the condition is met.

details.caption: Ad Image
details.help_tip:
Upload banner ad (JPG, PNG, GIF, animated GIF or flash file) file. Click on Browse or Choose button and select a file from your computer. For tips on images, click on 'Tutorials' from Site Manager and click on '22. Images / pictures'.

If you have chosen 'Ad Type = PeelerAd' for this AdGroup, we recommend you upload square images (Example: 100x100).

details.caption: Ad Link / Script
details.help_tip:
1. If this advertiser has a website and you would like this ad to be linked to his website, type his full link here. (Example: http://www.mycompany.com)

2. If you like to have google ad or have whether ad, copy and paste script here. Be sure enclose script with HTML and BODY tags.
For example:
< HTML >
< BODY >
... google/whether script ...
< /BODY >
< /HTML >

Or you can also leave this field blank and this ad will become a display ad only.

details.caption: Ad Image (big)
details.help_tip:
You can also choose to display bigger version of this ad. For example, you might have smaller ad above (under Ad Image) and larger ad here. Therefore, when visitor clicks on the smaller ad, system displays the larger from here. Click on Browse or Choose button and select a file from your computer. Recommended file size is less than 500 X 400 pixels. For tips on images, click on 'Tutorials' from Site Manager and click on '22. Images / pictures'.

If you have chosen 'Ad Type = PeelerAd' for this AdGroup, we recommend you upload square images (Example: 600x600).

details.caption: Ad Image (big) Window
details.help_tip: When uploading image in 'Ad Image (big)', choose 'New' if you have fairly large image that requires full browser window. If you have image that fits well within normal screen, choose 'Popup'.

details.caption: Anchor Text
details.help_tip: This Anchor Text will be shown when you mouse over to banner ad that you upload under Ad Image.

details.caption: Show Ad in Menus
details.lov_json: select menu + ' - ' + sub_menu as temp2 from [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus] m, [AppData2].[dbo].[sys_menus_subs] s where s.website_id = m.website_id and s.website_id = {website_id} and m.sys_menu_id = s.sys_menu_id and m.active = 'Yes'  and s.active = 'Yes' and s.menu_type = 'User' and len(sub_menu) > 0 and s.target_window not in ('Message','Link') union select null order by temp2
details.help_tip:
If you wish to show this ad on select sub-menus, select sub-menus from the drop-down list. Select -- ALL -- to show this ad in all sub-menus / pages.

For Windows: To select multiple sub-menus, hold down the Ctrl key and click.
For Mac: To select multiple sub-menus, hold down the Command key and click.

You can simply copy and paste text from your favorite word processor program such as Notepad or Word. details.caption: Picture Caption
details.help_tip: Optionally, type a picture caption here that will be displayed below the picture.

details.caption: Share Tools
details.help_tip: This allows you to share articles with Facebook, Twitter, etc.

details.caption: Website Title
details.help_tip: This Website Title is the first line displayed by the browsers on top. If left blank, system automatically uses Website Title from story Heading. We recommend that you keep your Meta Keywords and the Website Title the same.

details.caption: Meta Keywords
details.help_tip: This Meta Keywords is used for search engines that can build index of your site using these keywords. If left blank, system automatically uses keywords from story Heading. Separate the keywords by commas. Start off by using the most effective keywords. For example, if you are selling computers, you could type computers, laptops, laser printer, toner. We recommend that you keep your Meta Keywords and the Website Title the same.

details.caption: Meta Description

details.caption: Active

details.caption: Submitted

details.caption: Menu

details.caption: Heading
details.help_tip: As soon as the user submits his opinion, our system grabs the heading of the article and displays it in this field. You are not allowed to make any changes to this field.

details.caption: Visitor IP

details.caption: Visitor Email

details.caption: Opinion
details.help_tip: This is the opinion that the user has posted.  You can edit this opinion if you wish.

details.caption: Publish Opinion
details.help_tip: If Publish Opinion is Yes, then the user is giving you permission to publish his opinion on the web. If not, then the user does not grant you permission to publish his opinion. You are not allowed to make any changes to this field.

details.caption: Active
details.help_tip: Selecting 'Yes' will make this opinion available online immediately for other to read. This is basically an approval process flag.
