details.caption: Form Name
details.help_tip:
Give a unique name to this form. Make sure there are no spaces. For example, no spaces in between subscribe today, birth announcements, etc. However, you can separate them by under score. For example, Subscribe_Today, Birth_Announcements, etc.

There are some system forms starting with {{ and ending with }}. You can make changes to these forms as well.

details.caption: Description
details.help_tip: Describe this form name that will be seen by your visitors.

details.caption: Email To
details.help_tip: Enter an email address you want to assign to this form.  For example, when a visitor fills out the form and clicks on submit, system will send form information to the email address you provide here. Multiple email addresses can be entered by separating them with commas. IMPORTANT: Make sure that your form has email address field (Must include field name such as email, your email, etc.) so visitor can get copy of email as well as you get email from this visitor.  If you do not include email address field in your form, system will end up generating FROM and TO emails same from 'Email To' and as a result your email may end up against ISP policy and it may get blocked.

details.caption: Email CC
details.help_tip: Enter an optional CC email address you want to assign to this form.  Multiple email addresses can be entered by separating them with commas.

details.caption: Email BCC
details.help_tip: Enter an optional BCC (Blind Carbon Copy) email address you want to assign to this form.  Multiple email addresses can be entered by separating them with commas.

details.caption: Email Subject
details.help_tip: Enter meaningful email subject here so when you receive email notification you know exactly which form it relates to.  For example: ‘xyz.com:  Subscription received’.

details.caption: Email Confirm Message
details.help_tip: Enter a message that you would like the user to see after the form is submitted.  For example, ‘Your message has been forwarded to appropriate personnel.  Someone will contact you shortly.  Thank you.’

details.caption: Form Header
details.help_tip: Enter header to this form. The text that you enter here will appear on the top of the form. For example, you can give specific instructions regarding this form.

details.caption: Form Footer
details.help_tip: Enter footer to this form. The text that you enter here will appear on the bottom of the form. For example, you can give specific message regarding this form.

details.caption: Button Value
details.help_tip: Enter a button value here.  For example, submit, subscribe now!’, Submit your listing, etc.

details.caption: Email Format
details.help_tip: Choose email format for receiving emails.

details.caption: Send Email to Client
details.help_tip: Set 'No' if you do not want to send copy of this email to client.

details.caption: Export in CSV
details.help_tip: Choose Yes if you want to export user submitted information to CSV format that can be exported in to spreadsheet program.

details.caption: Combine Caption and Input
details.help_tip: Set this to Yes if you want to combine Caption and Input fields in a single column. This will reduce your width of the form.

details.caption: Order
details.help_tip: You can give order number to the fields such as 1, 2, 2.6, 3 etc.  The fields will be displayed on your home page according to the order number you have assigned here.

details.caption: Field Type
details.help_tip:
Choose appropriate field type as per your requirements:
Text: This field type is good for entering short information such as First Name, Last Name, etc.
Memo: This field is good for entering more information such as Comments, etc. where you do not know the length of the information.
Date: This field type is good for entering proper date.
Email: This field type is good for entering emails. System will give message to user if invalid email is entered.
CheckBox: Choose the checkbox option if you want this field to be a check box. For example, Over 18? The answer to this can be either Yes or No.
File: This field type is good for uploading images such gif or jpeg.
IPAddress: This special field type tells you who sent you all this information by collection client IP Address.
Divider: This is a special type of field that does not collect any information. It will simply create a gray divider wherever you think is necessary in the form. For better visual perspective, you insert this special field between group of information such as Billing Information and Shipping Information.
Hidden: This is special type of fields that is hidden from visitor but you can still assign default value that can be sent to you.

details.caption: Field Name
details.help_tip: Give a field name. For examples: First Name, Last Name, Address, State, Rate, etc. The characters _&% within field names are not allowed. (TIPS: By default, system does not email password information if field name contains 'Password'. However, if you like to receive password in emails, make lower case 'password' in field name.)

details.caption: Field Size
details.help_tip: Enter the size of this field. Default 100 value is sufficient in most cases. Maximum size is 10000. Type a number and W if you wish to restrict by number of words. Example: 10W

details.caption: Field Required
details.help_tip: If you select Yes then you are making this field a required field. A small * will be placed next to this field.

details.caption: Default Value
details.help_tip: Type an optional default value that you think most people will be entering. For example, if you have an address field with State field and if most users are coming from Texas state, put Texas here.

details.caption: Watermark
details.help_tip: You can provide help for visitors by putting watermark help in input boxes.

details.caption: Memo Count
details.help_tip: When having Memo/Textarea input boxes, set Yes if you wish to show characters or word count.

details.caption: List of Values
details.help_tip:
If you want visitors to choose a value from the predefined values such state listing, list all the states per line. Please note that you have to separate each option with an Enter. If last line is blank, that will appear as blank as well so be sure to remove blank line if not needed.
See some examples below.
State listing example:
Arizona
California
New York
South Carolina
Texas
Subscription rate listing example:
In town: 1 year/$30
In town: 2 year/$55
Out of town: 1 year/$40
Special Subscription rate listing example: (If you are processing credit card online, use this example so the system can extract amount value within special {}. Furthermore, this field name must be ‘Total Amount’ for system to recognize.
{30} In town: 1 year/$30
{55} In town: 2 year/$55
{40} Out of town: 1 year/$40

TIPS & TRICKS:
Use the following specials commands that will populate system lists:
{{Classifieds}}
{{ClassifiedsMajor}}
{{States}}
{{YellowPages}}
{{Years}}

It will place a small yellow bulb next to this field in the form.  When a user takes his mouse over this yellow bulb it will allow him to see the description of this field.

details.caption: Ad Type
details.help_tip:
DifferentSpotOnClick: Choose this option if you want to rotate ads on different spots every click. For example if you have 5 ads in this group, all 5 ads will rotate on all 5 spots every click.
DifferentSpotTime: Choose this option if you want to rotate ads on different spots every few seconds. For example if you have 5 ads in this group, all 5 ads will rotate on all 5 spots on every few seconds (Random Ads Interval) that you specify.
PopUp: Choose this option if you want to add popup ads. These popup ads are non-blockable by modern browsers.
SameSpotOnClick: Choose this option if you want to randomly rotate ads on same spot every click. For example if you have 5 ads in this group, all 5 ads will rotate on same spot every click.
SameSpotSequence: Choose this option if you want to rotate ads in sequence order on same spot every click. For example if you have 5 ads in this group, all 5 ads will rotate on same spot every click.
SameSpotTime: Choose this option if you want to rotate ads on same spot every few seconds. For example if you have 5 ads in this group, all 5 ads will rotate on same spot every few seconds (Random Ads Interval) that you specify.
Sticky: Choose this option if you want ads to stay sticky at all four sides of your screen. Unlike popup ads, a sticky ad cannot be scrolled past. By default, AdGroup1 through AdGroup4 is already setup for all four sides. All you have to do is activate AdGroup and add banner ads under select AdGroup.
PeelerAd: Choose this option if you want to have peer ad on the right corner of your screen. This option requires two images. We recommend 1st image to be 100x100 pix and second image to be 600x600 pix. Currently PeelerAd works with JPEG images only.
None: Choose this option if you do not want to rotate ads. Ads are displayed as per the order number that you specify.

details.caption: Random Ads Interval
details.help_tip: If you have chosen to rotate ads, enter rotation interval time in seconds.

This layout creates m.htm file for mobile users. Only {{PutDocType}},

details.caption: Free CSS Layout
details.help_tip:
When CSS code is entered, system creates layout.css file. If there are multiple layout records, system creates layoutN.css file where N is Menu ID.  Make sure to create proper CSS file including comments so it is easy to understand for any future changes. NOTE:  When entering CSS code here, you are NOT required to run process staff_update_pages.asp OR to request inner pages updates. This is because layoutN.css and styleN.css files are already included in HEADER part of 'Free HTML Layout' and you are only updating *.css files unless any of *.css files are missing from HEADER. Following CSS files get updated when you click on 'submit':

style.css – Belongs to {{main}} and codes comes from 'styles' screen.
styleN.css – N represents Menu ID and codes comes from 'styles' screen.
layout.css – Belongs to {{main}} and codes comes from 'Free CSS Layout' field.
layoutN.css – N represents Menu ID and codes comes from 'Free CSS Layout' field.

Make sure that above *.css files are present in HEADER part of 'Free HTML Layout' field.

details.caption: Free HTML Layout

1. Home page will not jerk during loading.

Setting No will have following 2 disadvantages:
1. Home page may jerk during loading.
2. Column width will be widened if images are wider than the columns.

details.caption: Restrict Access

You can make your site free or restrict access through paid options.
  • Select "No" if you want visitors to access your site for free.
  • Choose "Website" to restrict access to specific menus on your website.
  • Select "App" to restrict access to specific menus within your app.
  • Choose "Both" if you want to restrict access to menus on both the website and the app.

NOTE: Once photos are uploaded, changing size here again will not affect uploaded photos. System will use this size when you upload photos next time.

details.caption: Photo Size (Thumbnail)

details.caption: Starting HTML File
details.help_tip: You can upload your own starting HTML file that may include under construction page or special page that may include ads, links, images or starting flash file. Here is how to upload Under Construction Page: Click on 'Files' from Site Manager. Upload HTML file. Refer that exact HTML file name here. For example: UnderConstruction. System automatically appends .htm. Uploading Other Starting Page: Click on 'Files' from Site Manager. Upload HTML file. Refer that exact HTML file name here but add prefix 1 to this file. Adding prefix 1 only loads this file one time. For example: If you upload file StartingFile, enter 1StartingFile. System automatically appends .htm.

details.help_tip:
System automatically creates m.htm file that can be accessed via YourWebsite.com/m.htm where YourWebsite.com is your actual website. Set to Yes, if you want your mobile device users to automatically show m.htm of your website.
NOTE: * If you want to show full view of your desktop site on your mobile devices, create a support ticket.
* Submenu Headlines must be present to update m.htm file.

Section preview layout commands: {{LayoutPreview?Begin}} - where ? is a PKEY number, {{LayoutPreview?End}} - where ? is a PKEY number, {{LayoutPreview?Limit?}} - where ? is a PKEY number Apps layout commands: {{LayoutArticlesApps?Begin}} - where ? is a PKEY number, {{LayoutArticlesApps?End}} - where ? is a PKEY number, {{LayoutArticlesApps?Limit?}} - where ? is a PKEY number Menu layout commands: {{LayoutMenus?Begin}} - where ? is a number, {{LayoutMenus?End}} - where ? is a number, {{MakePopupScriptLinks:Yes}} - this creates popup links {{ReplaceJSONChars:Yes}} {{RemoveIDFromURL:Yes}} - This removes submenu id from urls. {{Where:MenuTypeInclude:?,?,?}} - where ? is 'Default', 'Hidden', 'Horizontal', 'Vertical', 'SandwichHorizontal', 'SandwichVertical' (If this command is nor present, all menus will be picked up.) {{Where:MenuAppsIncludeBlank:No}} - default is Yes {{Where:SubMenuAppsIncludeBlank:No}} - default is Yes {{Where:MenuIdInclude:?,?,?}} - where ? is a number or use ALL {{Where:MenuIdExclude:?,?,?}} - where ? is a number or use ALL {{Where:SubMenuIdInclude:?,?,?}} - where ? is a number or use ALL {{Where:SubMenuIdExclude:?,?,?}} - where ? is a number or use ALL {{Where:PageTypeInclude:?,?,?}} - where ? is Article, Gallery, Event2, Directory, etc. {{Where:PageTypeExclude:?,?,?}} - where ? is Article, Gallery, Event2, Directory, etc. {{RepeatBegin1}}, {{RepeatEnd1}}, {{RepeatBegin2}}, {{RepeatEnd2}}, {{Menu}}, {{MenuApps}}, {{MenuId}}, {{MenuStyle}}, {{MenuHTML}}, {{CSSColumns}}, {{MenuMouseOverCode}}, {{MenuOrder}} {{MenuNoRepeat}}, {{MenuIdNoRepeat}} {{SubMenu}}, {{SubMenuApps}}, {{SubMenuId}}, {{SubMenuLink}}, {{SubMenuStyle}}, {{SubMenuHTML}}, {{CSSDisplay}}, {{SubMenuOrder}} {{SubMenuNoRepeat}}, {{SubMenuIdNoRepeat}}, {{SubMenuLinkNoRepeat}}, {{SubMenuNoRepeatCSSDisplay}} {{SubMenuMouseInOutColor}} Article layout commands: {{LayoutArticle?Begin}} - where ? is a number, {{LayoutArticle?End}} - where ? is a number, {{LayoutArticle?Limit?}} - where ? is a number, {{LayoutArticleGroup?Begin}} - where ? is a number, {{LayoutArticleGroup?End}} - where ? is a number, {{LayoutArticleGroup?Limit?}} - where ? is a number, {{LayoutMenuLimit?}} ? is a number of menus, {{LayoutMenuArticlesLimit?}} ? is a number articles per menu, {{Where:MaxIssue}} - This restricts articles to latest issue date. {{Where:SubMenuIdInclude:?,?,?}} - where ? is a number or use ALL {{Where:SubMenuIdExclude:?,?,?}} - where ? is a number or use ALL {{Where:MenuAppsIncludeBlank:No}} - default is Yes {{Where:SubMenuAppsIncludeBlank:No}} - default is Yes {{Where:HighlightAllExclude}} - this excludes ALL highlights flag set to Yes {{Where:HighlightAllInclude}} - This includes ALL highlights flag set to Yes {{Where:HighlightInclude:?,?,?}} - where ? is a highlight number {{Where:HighlightIncludeAnd:?,?,?}} - where ? is a highlight number {{Where:MaxDaysUpdated:?}}- ? is number of past days to restrict articles {{Where:MaxDaysIssue:?}} - ? is number of past days to restrict articles. {{Where:MaxDaysCreated:?}} - ? is number of past days to restrict articles. {{Where:MaxDaysStarting:?}} - ? is number of past days to restrict articles. {{ArticleSubmitRequired:Yes}} - Works with article group layout. {{ExcludeKeywords:?,?,?,...}} - where ? is a keyword to be excluded from heading and body of the articles {{SkipArticles?}} - where ? is a number, {{ReplaceJavascriptChars:No}} {{RemoveHTMLBody}} - This strips HTML code from body. {{RemoveMore:Yes}} - This removes {{more}} command from articles body and shows content upto more. {{RemoveMoreFully:Yes}} - This removes {{more}} command from articles body and entire article is displayed {{MakeMobileLinks:Yes}} {{MakeAppLinks:Yes}} {{MakeFullLinks:Yes}} {{MakeStaticLinks:Yes}} - This does no change article links upon updates. {{LayoutArticleBodyWordLimit?}} - where ? is a number, {{SortBy:?}} - where ? could be Issue, Updated, Created, Menu, Heading, ByLine, Category or Order. Use commas if multiple sort is needed. By default, order is Descending (Desc). However, if you need Ascending order, use Asc command. Example: {{SortBy:Issue Asc}} {{BlankValue-Image1:?}} - where ? is image file name or use blank.gif {{Month?}} - where ? is U, I or C, shows month number {{Month?1}} - where ? is U, I or C, shows 3 letter month name {{Month?2}} -> where ? is U, I or C, shows 3 letter month name in upper case {{Month?3}} -> where ? is U, I or C, shows month name in upper/lower case {{Month?4}} -> where ? is U, I or C, shows month name in upper case {{Day?}} - where ? is U, I or C, shows day number {{Day?1}} - where ? is U, I or C, shows day number plus two letter {{Year?}} - where ? is U, I or C, shows year {{DayName?1}} - where ? is U, I or C, shows 3 letter week day name {{DayName?2}} - where ? is U, I or C, shows 3 letter week day name in upper case {{DayName?3}} - where ? is U, I or C, shows week day name in upper/lower case {{DayName?4}} - where ? is U, I or C, shows week day name in upper case {{Hour?}} - where ? is U or C {{Minute?}} - where ? is U or C {{Second?}} - where ? is U or C {{BlankValue-TotalArticles}} - makes layout blank if no articles found, {{TotalArticles}} {{Heading}}, {{HeadingLink}}, {{HeadingImage}}, {{HeadingImageAlt}} {{HeadingDisplay}} - sets style display:none, {{ArticleId}}, {{IssueDate}}, {{StartingDate}}, {{By}}, {{Source}}, {{Body}}, {{Picture1}}, {{Picture1Caption}}, {{PictureCaption}}, {{MetaTitle}}, {{MetaKeywords}}, {{MetadDescription}} {{AllowComments}}, {{ShareToolsTop}}, {{ShareToolsBottom}} {{Counter}}, {{CounterSubMenu}}, {{CounterAlphaUpperCase}}, {{CounterAlphaLowerCase}} {{CounterRomanUpperCase}}, {{CounterRomanLowerCase}} Other commands: {{File:?}} where ? is file name. Ex: articlegroup300.js {{FileUploaded:?,?,?}} where ? is table_name, column_name, column_id. Ex: {{FileUploaded:sys_styles_basic, file1_location, style_id=1}} {{HighlightBackgroundImage}} {{Http}} Prints http:// or https:// {{TotalRecords}} - this gives total number or records/rows/articles {{If Counter3;7;9}} ... some code... {{Else}} ... some code... {{EndIf}} * Currently two variables used for {{If}} command: Counter and Picture1 (See above examples). We will add as required. When using Counter, use number in place of ?, When using Picture1, use Blank if you want to test blank value to hide image. * Use Comparison operator such as <, >, <=, >=, <> and = with {{If}} command. {{Holder?}} - where ? is a number between 1 and 3 [[Holder?: ... some code ... ]] - holds value for {{Holder?}} command {{Find&ReplaceString:?1,?2}} - Where ?1 = find, ?2 = replace Example1: {{Find&ReplaceString:xyz,abc}} Example2: {{Find&ReplaceString:$D13$D10,<
>}} {{Find&ReplaceColumn:?1,?2,?3}} - Where ?1 = column, ?2 = find, ?3 = replace Example1: {{Find&ReplaceColumn:Body,xyz,abc}} Example2: {{Find&ReplaceColumn:Body,$D13$D10,<
>}} NOTE: You can put extra code by using : command within commands. Example: {{By:???}} or {{???:Source}} or {{???:Source:???}} where ??? can be any text or code. ??? will be printed only when value on By or Source exists.

details.help: JS
details.help_tip:
If left blank, the system will use the default JavaScript for the starting homepage.
If a script is entered here, it will override the default and be used for the starting homepage.

IMPORTANT:
<li>Always keep a backup before making any changes.
<li>The script must be pure JavaScript.
<li>Must validate your code using ChatGPT before pasting it here.
<li>Incorrect JavaScript may cause the homepage to become inaccessible.

Supported system commands:

<li>///ShortURLs/// — This will insert the entries from the Short URLs screen.

<li>///CleanURLs/// — This will remove .htm from URLs. If you wish to remove IDs from URLs, set "Clean URL = Yes".

details.caption: Highlight5 Limit (Display)
details.help_tip: After choosing total Highlight5 Limit in Setup: Options (Systems) screen, choose how many highlights to be shown for next scrolling.

details.caption: Highlight5 Limit
details.help_tip: When using Add to Highlight5 feature while uploading articles in Maintain: News/Articles screen, set the maximum articles display limit (up to 50) on your home page here.

details.caption: Real Estate Search Box
details.help_tip: Put HTML search box to search real estate properties. Delete all content if search box is not needed. Update caption or values to customize local language. Available commands: {{SubMenu}}, {{States}}, {{q}}

details.caption: Directory Search Box
details.help_tip: Put HTML search box to search directory. Delete all content if search box is not needed. Update caption or values to customize local language. Available commands: {{SubMenu}}, {{Category}}, {{States}}, {{q}}

details.caption: Previous Stories Layout
details.help_tip: Define layout for Previous Stories Per Page that is under sub-menu screen. If left blank, system puts Issue Date and Heading in one line.

details.caption: bulletlink.com Reference
details.help_tip: Make this line blank to remove {powered by bulletlink.com} from the bottom of home page. Be sure to run process to update inner pages.

details.caption: Compress Images Permanently
details.help_tip: System automatically sets flag to 'Compress Images=Yes' under 'Settings' screen every night. However, if user does not want to compress images permanently, set 'Compress Images Permanently=No' under 'Settings-Staff' screen. This also allows wider or bigger image uploads.

details.caption: Preserve Spacing
details.help_tip: HTML does not display multiple spaces, for example, between words. If you wish to display multiple spaces during paste or under PageDesigner, set Preserve Spacing = Yes. When html code nbsp; is included, styles will not work.

details.caption: Clean URLs
details.help_tip: This removes article IDs from url. For example: Setting 'Clean URLs = Yes' will create article URLS to http://MySite.com/lakers-won.htm instead of http://MySite.com/lakers-won-p193-90.htm. However, settings Yes will eliminate banner ad restriction functions.

details.caption: Unicode URLs
details.help_tip: This keeps article URLs as per the article Headings. Following characters in Headings will be replaced by dash: / \ : * ? " < > . |

details.help_tip: When subscription is expired, by default system uses {{NewMember}} form. Type different URL if you wish to go to different page.

details.caption: Allow Ticket Ratings

details.caption: Full Text Search
details.help_tip:
This flag is used with target_search.asp script. When set to Yes, multiple search keywords entered will be searched with OR operator. Example: when you search for Donald Trump, it will either search Donald or Trump. When set to No, multiple search keywords entered will be searched with AND operator. Example: when you search for Donald Trump, it will either search for exact Donald Trump.
NOTE: This search works on Headings and article Body only.

details.caption: Convert Char to HTML

details.caption: Form Name
details.help_tip:
Give a unique name to this form. Make sure there are no spaces. For example, no spaces in between subscribe today, birth announcements, etc. However, you can separate them by under score. For example, Subscribe_Today, Birth_Announcements, etc.

There are some system forms starting with {{ and ending with }}. You can make changes to these forms as well.
